questions.text: What is the primary definition of Systems Engineering?

answers.text: A transdisciplinary and integrative approach to enable successful system realization through the coordination of technical and managerial processes.
answers.explanation: Systems Engineering combines various disciplines and processes to ensure that systems meet stakeholder needs effectively.

answers.text: A purely technical process that focuses only on hardware design.
answers.explanation: Systems Engineering is not limited to hardware; it integrates both technical and managerial aspects across the lifecycle.

answers.text: A financial planning method for resource allocation.
answers.explanation: While cost considerations are important, Systems Engineering primarily focuses on the holistic integration of system components.

answers.text: A set of coding standards for software development.
answers.explanation: Systems Engineering encompasses much more than just software coding practices.
